sentences.sContent: This is nothing new.We have never been good at foretelling the future, but when the news isfavorable, others forgive our lack of prescience.
sentences.sContent_eng: This is nothing new.We have never been good at foretelling the future, but when the news isfavorable, others forgive our lack of prescience.
sentences.sCn: 像以往一样，我们从来不擅长对未来的预测，但是当都是好消息的时候，别人总是原谅我们缺乏预知。

sentences.sContent: Muhammad also told his followers to pray facing Jerusalem. He said God, in his "prescience," chose "the children of Israel ... above all peoples.
sentences.sContent_eng: Muhammad also told his followers to pray facing Jerusalem. He said God, in his "prescience," chose "the children of Israel ... above all peoples.
sentences.sCn: 穆罕默德还告诉他的信徒要面向耶路撒冷祈祷，他在“预知”中称主选择“以色列的子民为万民之首。”

sentences.sContent: That lack of prescience is hurting.
sentences.sCn: 缺乏先见之明，带来的是伤害。

remMethod.val: 来自prescien (t) (有先见之明的) + ce → 预知； 先见
